points.point: React is developed and maintained by developers from FaceBook, Instagram and a small community of developers from other organizations
The initial release of React was in March 2013, which would make it three years old
React is FaceBooks top repository by over tens-of-thousands of stars and is currently the fifth most starred repository on all of GitHub (only two-thousand stars ahead of Angular.js)
React is an open-source JavaScript library which renders data as HTML
React operates off of a 'data tree', which essentially boils down to passing data between 'reusable components'
To expand on 'reusable components', the best example would be a button component
We utilize 'props' to pass data around the tree, which will manipulate the button as required
We can also use 'PropTypes' to specify what we expect for the component ('isRequired' can specifically throw a console error if rules aren't followed)
'Reusable components' should be kept as small as possible; if they serve more than one purpose create a new component
Here's how FaceBook describes component-based development within React:
Since component logic is written in JavaScript instead of templates you can easily pass rich data through your app and keep state out of the DOM.
You can take advantage of 'state', which will allow for the DOM to rerender every time a components state changes
This can be really powerful when handling DOM changes
In its simplest form React will allow for a cleaner, more efficient and much faster application than a plain HTML application
